column4: Hi there. Having some issues hosting a game on my local area net.  They can find me, but they can't connect to me. so im suspecting a firewall issue. doing some googling but cant find the correct answer. Anyone?
disable your firewall and try it out to confirm your suspicion
paste "sudo iptables -L"
http://pastebin.com/m3e9f59df
iptables is not blocking anything
Any ideas on whats wrong then ?:P xD
hehe kind of hard to tell
hehe, indeed. I just remember that i had a furmiliar problem on windows, and there it was the firewall :P
have you tried ping, or maybe ssh or something to confirm that it's the game and not something else?
nope i havent. Abit of a newbie to ubuntu atm, so no idea howto xD
Attempted a ping, time=0.087ms :P
a ping is as simple as it gets, try "ping -c 4 yourip" from a client
ok then it should be something specific to the game
what game is it btw?
Wc3:P running on cedega
ah it's not native
Can it be that i have to forward something for cedega aswell? hmm
Any ideas?^^
I did a fast google search but didn't find anything...sorry
darnit... :(
